subject: Science
script: Water is a liquid that we drink to stay alive. It is found in rivers, lakes, and the ocean.

subject: Math
script: Addition means putting numbers together. For example, 2 + 3 = 5.

subject: History
script: Mahatma Gandhi was a leader who helped India get independence using non-violence.

subject: English
script: A noun is a word that names a person, place, or thing. Example: Dog, India, Book.

subject: Science
script: Gravity is the force that pulls things towards the Earth. It is why we don’t float away!

subject: Math
script: Multiplication is repeated addition. Example: 3 × 4 means 3 added 4 times, which is 12.

subject: Geography
script: The Earth is divided into seven large land masses called continents. Example: Asia, Africa.

subject: Physics
script: An object will stay at rest or keep moving unless a force acts on it. This is called Inertia.

subject: Chemistry
script: An atom is the smallest unit of matter. Everything around us is made of atoms.

subject: Economics
script: When demand is high and supply is low, prices go up. When supply is high and demand is low, prices drop.
